item.title: T-bill supply will turn negative soon without a U.S. debt-limit deal: BofA
item.description: Incoming President Donald Trump’s second administration kicks off as the U.S. debt-ceiling debate enters another critical juncture.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.4% To 103.33
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was up 0.4% to 103.33 — snapping a four-trading-day losing streak.

item.title: Starbucks’s turnaround plan under new CEO now likely includes job cuts
item.description: Coffee chain Starbucks’s promised overhaul may require cutting jobs as it tries to work more efficiently, CEO Brian Niccol said.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Gives Solomon $80 Million to Stay
item.description: Retention bonus and big pay raise quell any remaining questions about the CEO’s ability to stay in place

item.title: The Man Making Billions From the Wildest Bitcoin Bet
item.description: MicroStrategy’s Michael Saylor is buying as much of the cryptocurrency as he can. Some big-name investors are going along for the ride.

item.title: When a spouse dies, there can be a ‘tax explosion’ for the one left behind
